result.execSummary:
The defendant Reece L. Sharp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational or treatment programs as directed by the agent.

Pay costs.  

Court makes 973.015 finding for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  Defendant to follow up with Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reece L. Sharp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reece L. Sharp in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  Def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  1 year probation, sentence withheld.  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any educational or treatment programs as directed by agent; pay costs.  Court makes 973.015 finding for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

DNA sample to be submitted prior to signing up for probation.

Defendant Reece L. Sharp in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance completed.  NG plea entered.  Status requested and set.  State is contemplating new case filing (bail jumping).  Both matters will be adj. to 11/4 at 1:30.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Reece L. Sharp
Current: 1309 Temkin Ave. Apt. 3, Madison, WI 53705 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2015)
Prior: 21132 Bosstown Road, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Reece L. Sharp in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states the charges and informs def of possible max. penalties as well as his rights.  Def to contact SPD re elig.  Adj. to 10/14 at 9.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
